entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series â€“ Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content:
Hi @jeetendrakapase  and thank you for the insightful post. 

I cannot quite understand what is the benefit of using data products for analytics and reporting.

In reporting scenarios where speed is a key factor, we anyways need to replicate the data in Datasphere and have it In-memory. For this we can just acquire data via replication flows from CDS views on S4 side. Yes, the data products add semantics to the raw tables, but in Datasphere there is already semantic onboarding and the described result seems to be quite similar. 

For scenarios where speed is not a big factor, we can still access S4 CDS views as remote tables.

In both cases, the additional storage in FOS seems redundant, so perhaps I am missing something.

Could you, please, elaborate on this?

entry.title: WM Inbound flow with 2 storage locations and 2 storage bins
entry.content:
Hello,

For my customer, I created 2 WM Storage Locations.

For Inbound flow, one product can be delivered on the 2 Storage Locations.

In the Purchase Order, the requested Storage Location is indicated.

I created 2 Storage Bins to manage the goods receipt  FLIX-GR-AREA and FOX-GR-AREA and depending on the Storage Location indicated in the Purchase Order.

I would like to know what is the relevant customizing to have the correct Storage Location when I create the Inbound Delivery.

 

Can you help ?

entry.title: Clarification on CVE-2025-42951 â€“ Which Support Package Patches Are Safe?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Iâ€™m reviewing SAP Security Note 3625403 regarding CVE-2025-42951 (Broken Authorization in SAP Business One SLD).

In the note it says: â€œPlease implement the Support Packages and Patches referenced in this SAP security Note.â€
When I click on the Support Package Patches link inside the note, it redirects me to the SAP Download Center where I see a full list of installation packages (Feature Packages, Support Packages, etc.) for SAP Business One 10.0.

My question is:

  • Are all versions listed on that download page considered safe, or

  • Is the vulnerability fixed only in Support Package Patches released after 12 August 2025 (the publication date of the note)?

I want to be sure whether older Feature Packages shown in that list (e.g. FP 2011, FP 2208, etc.) are actually patched, or if only the newer ones (2502 and later) include the fix.

Has anyone clarified this with SAP or tested which Support Package levels are secured?

Thanks in advance for your input!

  • EMEAã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã‚‚åŒæ§˜ã«ã€5æœˆã®ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãŒ6æœˆã«æŒç¶šã—ãªã‹ã£ãŸç†ç”±ï¼ˆã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³çµ‚äº†ã€ä¸»è¦é¡§å®¢ã®å­£ç¯€çš„éœ€è¦æ¸›ï¼‰ã‚’æŠŠæ¡ã—ã€æ¬¡æœŸã®è²©å£²è¨ˆç”»ã«åæ˜ ã•ã›ã‚‹å¿…è¦ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚
  • APJã®äºˆæ¸¬ãŒå–å¾—ã§ãã¦ã„ãªã„ç‚¹ã¯ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿å–å¾—ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹ã®å†ç¢ºèªã¨ã€å¿…è¦ãªã‚‰ã°åˆ¥é€”äºˆæ¸¬ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã‚’èµ°ã‚‰ã›ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

    ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã‚‚å…·ä½“çš„ãªå†…å®¹ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚


ã¾ãŸã€è¿½åŠ ã®è³ªå•ã¨ã—ã¦ã€åˆ†æçµæœã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã€Œä»Šå›åˆ†æã«ç‰¹å¾´é‡ãƒ»æ©Ÿæ¢°å­¦ç¿’ã‚’åˆ©ç”¨ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹èªè­˜ã§ã™ãŒã€ãã‚ŒãŒã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå†…å®¹ã‹ã¨ã€ä»Šå›ã®åˆ†æã«ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«ä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‹ã‚’èª¬æ˜ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ã€ã¨è³ªå•ã—ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå›ç­”ãŒè¿”ã£ã¦ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

  • ç‰¹å¾´é‡ã¯ã€Œå¹´æœˆã€ã€Œåœ°åŸŸã€ã€Œè£½å“ã€ã€Œéå»æ•°ã‹æœˆã®å£²ä¸Šã€ã€Œå­£ç¯€æŒ‡æ¨™ã€ã€Œå¤–éƒ¨ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒ•ãƒ©ã‚°ã€ãªã©ã€æ™‚ç³»åˆ—ã¨ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªæƒ…å ±ã‚’çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚
  • ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã¯å­£ç¯€æ€§ãƒ»ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’æ‰ãˆã‚‹çµ±è¨ˆçš„æ‰‹æ³•ã¨ã€æ®‹å·®ã‚’äºˆæ¸¬ã™ã‚‹å‹¾é…ãƒ–ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚°æœ¨ï¼ˆXGBoost ç­‰ï¼‰ã‚’ãƒã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒªãƒƒãƒ‰ã«ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚
  • ä»Šå›ã¯7æœˆã®å£²ä¸Šäºˆæ¸¬ã«ã ã‘æ©Ÿæ¢°å­¦ç¿’ãŒåˆ©ç”¨ã•ã‚Œã€å®Ÿç¸¾ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¨ã®ä¹–é›¢ã‹ã‚‰ã€äºˆæ¸¬å¯¾è±¡ã®è£½å“æŠœã‘ã‚„å­£ç¯€æ€§ã®éåº¦ãªä½æ¸›ãŒå•é¡Œã§ã‚ã‚‹ã¨åˆ¤æ˜ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

AIã¯ã•ã‚‰ã«ã€äºˆæ¸¬ç²¾åº¦ã‚’ä¸Šã’ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ç¤ºå”†ã¨ã—ã¦ã€APIãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ«ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®è¦‹ç›´ã—ã€å¤–éƒ¨ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒˆæƒ…å ±ã®çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿ã€ãƒ©ã‚°ã‚„ç§»å‹•å¹³å‡ã®è¨­å®šã€å­¦ç¿’æœŸé–“ã®æ‹¡å¼µãªã©ã‚’ææ¡ˆã—ã¦ãã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã‚‚ã¡ã‚ã‚“ã€ã“ã®åˆ†æãŒæ­£ã—ã„ã‹ã¯ç¾æ™‚ç‚¹ã§ã¯çŸ¥ã‚‹ç”±ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ãŒã€ã¾ã‚‹ã§ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿åˆ†æã®å°‚é–€å®¶ãŒä¼´èµ°ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã§ã‚ã‚Šã€å°‚é–€å®¶ï¼ˆãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚µã‚¤ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ãƒˆï¼‰ã§ãªãã¦ã‚‚ã€ç²¾åº¦ã‚’ä¸Šã’ã¦ã„ãã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ã‚’æ„Ÿã˜ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

ã“ã®ãƒãƒ³ã‚ºã‚ªãƒ³ã‚’é€šã—ã¦ã€ãƒ“ã‚¸ãƒã‚¹ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦AIã‚’å®Ÿéš›ã«æ´»ç”¨ã—ã€åˆ†æãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã®ä½œæˆã‹ã‚‰äºˆæ¸¬ã«åŸºã¥ã„ãŸç¤ºå”†ã®å°å‡ºã¾ã§ã®ä¸€é€£ã®æµã‚Œã‚’ã€Databricksä¸Šã§ä½“é¨“ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†è²´é‡ãªå­¦ã³ã‚’å¾—ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series â€“ Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@PraveenJelli - Please find answers to Qs:

Disk + Memory Spaces
Is it possible to create a data product from a space that uses disk + memory (instead of memory-only)?

In SAP Datasphere, data products fall into two categories:

Data Marketplace Products â€“ Built within Datasphere, these can persist data in disk + memory and be shared across different spaces. However, they are not Delta-Share enabled and cannot be shared with databricks as of today.

BDC (Delta-Share Enabled) Products â€“ Persisted in the object store/data lake (HDLF) as Delta Lake tables. Since the Delta-Share protocol requires data to be stored as Delta Lake tables, these products are specifically designed for external sharing and interoperability.

Integration Hours Calculation
How to calculate the integration effort (hours) required to replicate data from S/4 to a space with disk + memory or to the object store?

Please refer the sizing blog: Replication Flow Blog Series Part 4 - Sizing
Incorrect Data Handling
How can we correct invalid dates or field values (e.g., .00.0000 in date fields) when loading data from S/4 to Datasphere?
Since replication flows (RF) cannot handle such corrections directly, what is the best practice for remediation?

Two approaches are recommended:

  1. Source-side handling â€“ Perform the conversion or cleanup in the source system (e.g., enhance the CDS view with transformation logic).

  2. Datasphere replication flow + transformation flow â€“ Create a replication flow (Extract-Load) with an inbound table to capture replicated data , then build a transformation flow to clean/convert the data before loading it into the final target table (Transform-Load). This approach creates separate staging/materialized layers for better control.

Hope this helps and happy learning - Jeet

entry.title: Excel Upload/ Download Template/ Download Processed Data in SAP Fiori Without SAPUI5 - Using SAP RAP
entry.content:
In many projects, there is a common requirement to develop utilities for mass creation or update of business objects such as Purchase Orders, Materials, Sales Orders, Billing Documents etc. With the adoption of SAP S/4HANA, customers are increasingly opting for SAP Fiori applications over traditional classical reports for such use cases.

A frequent question arises:
Can we develop a Fiori application to upload files without building a custom SAPUI5 front end?
Yes, we can!

Thanks to SAPâ€™s RESTful Application Programming (RAP) model and the use of specific annotations, it is possible to handle file uploads directly within a Fiori Elements application. No need for custom UI5 development.

To enable file uploads in RAP, the following annotation is crucial:

@Semantics.largeObject

This annotation allows handling of large file content (LOBs) in the RAP model. However, there is one important requirement:
You need to create a dedicated database table to store the uploaded file as a large object.

In below Example, I am explaining how Billing Date can be changed through Mass Upload.

In Excel Template I have two columns
Billing Document and New Billing date (DD.MM.YYYY).
Letâ€™s walk through the steps to implement this.

Create Database and Draft Tables

We will begin by creating two database tables and their respective draft tables:

  1. Parent Table â€“ Stores file metadata and the file content itself (LOB).
  2. Child Table â€“ Stores the extracted data from the uploaded file. In this example, we will process a XLSX file.
Parent Table â€“ ZTOM_T_USER

This table will store the uploaded file and its metadata. Hereâ€™s a sample structure:

@EndUserText.label : 'User Table for Excel Processing'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_user {
  key mandt             : mandt not null;
  key end_user          : syuname not null;
  status                : abap.char(20);
  attachment            : ztom_de_attach;
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;

}

This setup ensures the uploaded file can be stored as a RAWSTRING (LENGTH 0) in the backend.

 

Parent Draft Table â€“ ZTOM_T_USERD
@EndUserText.label : 'User Draft Table for Excel Processing'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_userd {
  key mandt             : mandt not null;
  key end_user          : syuname not null;
  status                : abap.char(20);
  attachment            : ztom_de_attach;
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;
  "%admin"              : include sych_bdl_draft_admin_inc;

}

 

Child Table â€“ ZTOM_T_EXCEL

This table will store the extracted data from the uploaded file. In this example, we will process a XLSX file. Hereâ€™s a sample structure:

@EndUserText.label : 'Excel Data Table'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_excel {
  key mandt    : mandt not null;
  @AbapCatalog.foreignKey.screenCheck : false
  key end_user : syuname not null
    with foreign key ztom_t_user
      where end_user = ztom_t_excel.end_user;
  key vbeln    : vbeln_vf not null;
  new_fkdat    : abap.char(10);
  prev_fkdat   : abap.char(10);
  type         : bapi_mtype;
  message      : bapi_msg;

}

 

Child Draft Table â€“ ZTOM_T_EXCELD
@EndUserText.label : 'Excel Data Draft Table'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_exceld {
  key mandt    : mandt not null;
  key end_user : syuname not null;
  key vbeln    : vbeln_vf not null;
  new_fkdat    : abap.char(10);
  prev_fkdat   : abap.char(10);
  type         : bapi_mtype;
  message      : bapi_msg;
  "%admin"     : include sych_bdl_draft_admin_inc;

}

 

Create Interface View

Now, let's create Interface views on top of the tables we just created.

Parent Interface View â€“ ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface View - Excel User'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define root view entity ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
  as select from    usr02       as _user
    left outer join ztom_t_user as _XLUser on _user.bname = _XLUser.end_user
  composition [0..*] of ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL as _XLData
{
  key _user.bname                   as end_user,
      _XLUser.status                as status,
      _XLUser.attachment            as Attachment,
      @Semantics.mimeType: true
      _XLUser.mimetype              as MimeType,
      _XLUser.filename              as Filename,
      @Semantics.user.createdBy: true
      _XLUser.local_created_by      as Local_Created_By,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.createdAt: true
      _XLUser.local_created_at      as Local_Created_At,
      @Semantics.user.lastChangedBy: true
      _XLUser.local_last_changed_by as Local_Last_Changed_By,
      //local ETag field --> OData ETag
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true
      _XLUser.local_last_changed_at as Local_Last_Changed_At,
      //total ETag field
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      _XLUser.last_changed_at       as Last_Changed_At,

      _XLData
}
where
  _user.bname = $session.user

 

Child Entity Interface View â€“ ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface View - Excel Data'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define view entity ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
  as select from ztom_t_excel
  association to parent ZCDS_TOM_I_USER as _XLUser on $projection.end_user = _XLUser.end_user
{
  key end_user                as end_user,
  key ztom_t_excel.vbeln      as Vbeln,
      ztom_t_excel.new_fkdat  as New_Fkdat,
      ztom_t_excel.prev_fkdat as Prev_Fkdat,
      ztom_t_excel.type       as Type,
      ztom_t_excel.message    as Message,

      _XLUser
}

 

Create Projection/ Consumption View

Now, let's create Projection/ Consumption views on top of the Interfaces we just created.

Parent Projection/ Consumption View â€“ ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Projection Entity - Excel User'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define root view entity ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
  provider contract transactional_query
  as projection on ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
{
  key end_user,
      @EndUserText.label: 'Processing Status'
      status as status,
      @Semantics.largeObject: {
          mimeType: 'MimeType',
          fileName: 'Filename',
          acceptableMimeTypes: [ 'application/vnd.ms-excel','application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet' ],
          contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE } // This will store the File into our table
      Attachment,
      MimeType,
      Filename,
      Local_Created_By,
      Local_Created_At,
      Local_Last_Changed_By,
      @EndUserText.label: 'Last Changed At'
      Local_Last_Changed_At,
      Last_Changed_At,

      /* Associations */
      _XLData : redirected to composition child ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
}

 

Child Entity Projection/ Consumption View â€“ ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Projection Entity - Excel Data'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define view entity ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
  as projection on ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
{
  key end_user,
  key Vbeln,
      New_Fkdat,
      Prev_Fkdat,
      Type,
      Message,
      /* Associations */
      _XLUser : redirected to parent ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
}

 

Create Metadata Extensions

Now, let's create Metadata Extensions on top of the Projection/ Consumption views we just created.

Parent Metadata Extension â€“ ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
@Metadata.layer: #CORE
@UI.headerInfo: {
    typeName: 'Mass Upload for Billing Date Change',
    typeNamePlural: 'Mass Upload for Billing Date Change'
}
annotate entity ZCDS_TOM_C_USER with
{
  .facet: [
  { id: 'idEndUser',    purpose: #HEADER,       position: 10,   type: #DATAPOINT_REFERENCE,     targetQualifier: 'tqEndUser'
  },
  { id: 'idChgAt',      purpose: #HEADER,       position: 20,   type: #DATAPOINT_REFERENCE,     targetQualifier: 'tqChgAt'
  },
  { id: 'idStatus',     purpose: #HEADER,       position: 30,   type: #DATAPOINT_REFERENCE,     targetQualifier: 'tqStatus'
  },
  { id: 'idFile',       purpose: #STANDARD,     position: 50,   type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE,    label: 'File Upload/ Download'
  },
  { id: 'idData',       purpose: #STANDARD,     position: 60,   type: #LINEITEM_REFERENCE,          label: 'Excel Data',    targetElement: '_XLData'
  } ]

  .lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Person Responsible' }]
  .dataPoint: { qualifier: 'tqEndUser', title: 'Person Responsible' }
  .identification: [{ type: #FOR_ACTION, dataAction: 'downloadData', label: 'Download Data' }] //Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this
  end_user;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'File Status' }]
  .dataPoint: { qualifier: 'tqStatus', title: 'File Status' }
  status;
  .identification: [{ position: 10, label: 'Upload/ Download Template & Excel File' }]
  Attachment;
  .lineItem: [{ type: #FOR_ACTION, dataAction: 'downloadTemplate', label: 'Download Template' }]
  .identification: [{ type: #FOR_ACTION, dataAction: 'downloadTemplate', label: 'Download Template' }]
  .hidden: true
  MimeType;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Filename' }]
  Filename;
  .hidden: true
  Local_Created_By;
  .hidden: true
  Local_Created_At;
  .hidden: true
  Local_Last_Changed_By;
  .dataPoint: { qualifier: 'tqChgAt', title: 'Last Changed At' }
  .lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'Last Changed At' }]
  Local_Last_Changed_At;
  .hidden: true
  Last_Changed_At;
  /* Associations */
  .hidden: true
  _XLData;

}

 

Child Entity Metadata Extension â€“ ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
@Metadata.layer: #CORE
@UI.headerInfo: {
    typeName: 'Processed Billing Data',
    typeNamePlural: 'Processed Billing Data'
}
annotate entity ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL with
{
  .hidden: true
  //  .lineItem: [{ type: #FOR_ACTION, label: 'Display Document', dataAction: 'displayDocument' }]
  end_user;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Billing Document' }]
  Vbeln;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'New Billing Date' }]
  New_Fkdat;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Previous Billing Date' }]
  Prev_Fkdat;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'Status' }]
  Type;
  .lineItem: [{ position: 50, label: 'Message' }]
  Message;
  /* Associations */
  .hidden: true
  _XLUser;

}

 

Create Behavior Definitions Behavior Implementation and Behavior Projection

Now, let's create Behavior Definitions on top of the Parent Interface View and Behavior Projection on Parent Projection/ Consumption View we just created.

Behavior Definition â€“ ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
managed implementation in class zbp_cl_cds_tom_i_user unique;
strict ( 2 );
with draft;

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_I_USER alias XLHead
persistent table ztom_t_user
lock master
total etag end_user
draft table ztom_t_userd
//early numbering
authorization master ( instance )
etag master end_user
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  field ( readonly ) end_user;

  action ( features : instance ) downloadTemplate result [1] $self;
  action ( features : instance ) downloadData result [1] $self; //Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this

  // Logic to read excel data into into internal table and save to the child entity
  action ( features : instance ) uploadExcelData result [1] $self;

  association _XLData { create; with draft; }

  // Logic to trigger action uploadExcelData
  determination fields on modify { field Filename; }

  //Draft actions
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Activate;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

}

CLASS lhc_XLHead DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR XLHead RESULT result.

    METHODS downloadTemplate FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~downloadTemplate RESULT result.

    METHODS fields FOR DETERMINE ON MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR XLHead~Fields.

    METHODS uploadExcelData FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~uploadExcelData RESULT result.

    "Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this method
    METHODS downloadData FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~downloadData RESULT result.

*    METHODS earlynumbering_create FOR NUMBERING
*      IMPORTING entities FOR CREATE XLHead.

    METHODS get_instance_features FOR INSTANCE FEATURES
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_features FOR XLHead RESULT result.

ENDCLASS.


CLASS lhc_XLHead IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD downloadTemplate.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lv_content   TYPE xstring,
          lv_mime_type TYPE string.

*-- Local Internal Table Declaration
    DATA: lt_bin TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF solix.

    "Clear all local objects
    CLEAR: lv_content, lv_mime_type, lt_bin.

*-- Retrieve File From MIME Repository
*-- accessing the file path '/SAP/PUBLIC/ZTOM_MASS_BILLING_DATE_UPD/Billing Date Update Template.xlsx'
    cl_mime_repository_api=>if_mr_api~get_api( )->get( EXPORTING  i_url              = TEXT-001
                                                                  i_check_authority  = abap_false
                                                       IMPORTING  e_content          = lv_content
                                                                  e_mime_type        = lv_mime_type
                                                       EXCEPTIONS parameter_missing  = 1
                                                                  error_occured      = 2
                                                                  not_found          = 3
                                                                  permission_failure = 4
                                                                  OTHERS             = 5 ).

    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      "Handle Error Messages
      INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                          number   = sy-msgno
                          severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                          v1       = sy-msgv1
                          v2       = sy-msgv2
                          v3       = sy-msgv3
                          v4       = sy-msgv4 )
             INTO TABLE reported-%other.
    ELSE.
      "Modify Root Entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                           ( end_user            = key-end_user
                             status              = TEXT-002 "Template Downloaded
                             Attachment          = lv_content
                             Filename            = TEXT-003 "Billing Date Update Template
                             MimeType            = lv_mime_type
                             %control-status     = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Attachment = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Filename   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-MimeType   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
      FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

      "Read Updated Entry
      READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      ALL FIELDS WITH
      CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
      RESULT DATA(lt_XLHead).

      "Send Status back to front end
      result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_XLHead
                        ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                          %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD fields.
    SELECT  INTO (lv_valid) FROM ztom_t_user UP TO 1 ROWS WHERE end_user = -uname.
    ENDSELECT.

    IF lv_valid <> abap_true.
      INSERT ztom_t_user FROM @( VALUE #( end_user = sy-uname ) ).
    ENDIF.

    IF keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft = '01'. "for oDataV4 '01' needs to be replaced with '00'
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      EXECUTE uploadexceldata
      FROM CORRESPONDING #( keys ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD uploadExcelData.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lv_index    TYPE sy-index.

*-- Local Workarea Declaration
    DATA: ls_vbrk_i TYPE vbrk.

*-- Local Internal Table Declaration
    DATA: lt_excel TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zbp_cl_cds_tom_i_user=>gty_input,
          lt_data  TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zcds_tom_i_user\_XLData.

*-- Local Object Declaration
    DATA: lo_table_descr  TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          lo_struct_descr TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr.

*-- Local Field Symbol Declaration
    FIELD-SYMBOLS:  <lfs_col_header> TYPE any.

    "Clear all local objects
    CLEAR: lv_index, lt_excel, lt_data.

    SELECT  INTO (lv_valid) FROM ztom_t_user UP TO 1 ROWS WHERE end_user = -uname.
    ENDSELECT.

    IF lv_valid <> abap_true.
      INSERT ztom_t_user FROM @( VALUE #( end_user = sy-uname ) ).
    ENDIF.

    DATA(lv_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).

    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    ALL FIELDS WITH
    CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_file_entity).

    DATA(lv_attachment) = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-attachment.

    IF lv_attachment IS INITIAL.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    "Move Excel Data to Internal Table
    DATA(lo_xlsx) = xco_cp_xlsx=>document->for_file_content( iv_file_content = lv_attachment )->read_access( ).
    DATA(lo_worksheet) = lo_xlsx->get_workbook( )->worksheet->at_position( 1 ).
    DATA(lo_selection_pattern) = xco_cp_xlsx_selection=>pattern_builder->simple_from_to( )->get_pattern( ).
    DATA(lo_execute) = lo_worksheet->select( lo_selection_pattern )->row_stream( )->operation->write_to(
                                                                      REF #( lt_excel ) ).
    lo_execute->set_value_transformation( xco_cp_xlsx_read_access=>value_transformation->string_value )->if_xco_xlsx_ra_operation~execute( ).

    "Get number of columns in upload file for validation
    TRY.
        lo_table_descr ?= cl_abap_tabledescr=>describe_by_data( p_data = lt_excel ).
        lo_struct_descr ?= lo_table_descr->get_table_line_type( ).
        DATA(lv_no_of_cols) = lines( lo_struct_descr->components ).
      CATCH cx_sy_move_cast_error INTO DATA(lo_sy_move_cast_error).

        "Implement error handling
        INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                            number   = sy-msgno
                            severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                            v1       = sy-msgv1
                            v2       = sy-msgv2
                            v3       = sy-msgv3
                            v4       = sy-msgv4 )
               INTO TABLE reported-%other.
    ENDTRY.

*-- Remove Headings of Columns from Excel data
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE lt_excel INDEX 1.
    ENDIF.

*-- Remove all entries where Billing document is not available
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE lt_excel WHERE vbeln IS INITIAL.
    ENDIF.

*-- Remove all duplicates
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_excel.
    ENDIF.

    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT lt_excel ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_excel>).
        DO lv_no_of_cols TIMES.
          lv_index = sy-index.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_index OF STRUCTURE <lfs_excel> TO <lfs_col_header>.
          IF <lfs_col_header> IS NOT ASSIGNED.
            CONTINUE.
          ENDIF.
          DATA(lv_has_error) = abap_false.
          CASE lv_index.
            WHEN 1. "Billing Document Number
              CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
                EXPORTING
                  input  = <lfs_col_header>
                IMPORTING
                  output = <lfs_col_header>.

              SELECT SINGLE fkdat
                FROM vbrk
                INTO (lv_fkdat)
                WHERE vbeln = @<lfs_col_header>.

              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                <lfs_excel>-prev_fkdat = |{ lv_fkdat+6(2) }.{ lv_fkdat+4(2) }.{ lv_fkdat(4) }|.
                CLEAR: lv_fkdat.
              ENDIF.

            WHEN 2.  "New Billing Date
              FIND PCRE '(\d{1,2}[.]\d{1,2}[.]\d{4})' IN <lfs_col_header>.
              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                CALL FUNCTION '/SAPDMC/LSM_DATE_CONVERT'
                  EXPORTING
                    date_in             = <lfs_col_header>
                    date_format_in      = 'DDMY'
                    to_output_format    = ' '
                    to_internal_format  = 'X'
                  IMPORTING
                    date_out            = <lfs_col_header>
                  EXCEPTIONS
                    illegal_date        = 1
                    illegal_date_format = 2
                    no_user_date_format = 3
                    OTHERS              = 4.
                IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                  <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                  <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
                ELSE.
                  IF <lfs_col_header>+0(2) EQ '00'.
                    <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                    <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
                  ELSE.
                    lv_fkdat = <lfs_col_header>.
                  ENDIF.
                ENDIF.
              ELSE.
                <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
              ENDIF.
            WHEN 3 OR 4 OR 5.
              "Do Nothing!!
*              lv_has_error = COND #( WHEN <lfs_col_header> <> ' ' THEN abap_true ELSE lv_has_error ).
            WHEN OTHERS. "More than 5 columns (error)
              lv_has_error = abap_true.
          ENDCASE.
          UNASSIGN <lfs_col_header>.
        ENDDO.
        IF lv_has_error = abap_true.
          APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky ) TO failed-xlhead.
          APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky
                          %msg = new_message_with_text( severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                                        text     = TEXT-005 ) ) "Wrong File Format!!
          TO reported-xlhead.
          UNASSIGN <lfs_col_header>.
          EXIT.
        ELSE. "Process Data
          "Update Billing Date
          IF <lfs_excel>-type <> 'E'.
            TRY.
                zcl_tom_billing_date_upd=>zfm_tom_billing_date_upd( EXPORTING fkdat   = lv_fkdat
                                                                              vbeln   = <lfs_excel>-vbeln
*                                                                              _dest_  = 'NONE'
                                                                    CHANGING  message = <lfs_excel>-message
                                                                              mtype   = <lfs_excel>-type ).
              CATCH cx_aco_application_exception INTO DATA(lo_aco_application_exception).
              CATCH cx_aco_communication_failure INTO DATA(lo_aco_communication_failure).
              CATCH cx_aco_system_failure INTO DATA(lo_aco_system_failure).

                "Implement error handling
                INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                    number   = sy-msgno
                                    severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                    v1       = sy-msgv1
                                    v2       = sy-msgv2
                                    v3       = sy-msgv3
                                    v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                       INTO TABLE reported-%other.
            ENDTRY.

            "Change Format to DD.MM.YYYY
            <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat = |{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat+6(2) }.{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat+4(2) }.{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat(4) }|.

          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.

    ELSE.
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky ) TO failed-xlhead.
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky
                      %msg = new_message_with_text( severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                                    text     = TEXT-006 ) ) "No Input Data to Process in Excel!!
      TO reported-xlhead.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.

*-- Sort with Error & Success type
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      SORT: lt_excel ASCENDING BY type vbeln.
    ENDIF.

    "Prepare Data for Child Entity (XLData)
    lt_data = VALUE #( ( %cid_ref  = keys[ 1 ]-%cid_ref
                         %is_draft = keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft
                         end_user  = keys[ 1 ]-end_user
                         %target   = VALUE #( FOR lwa_excel IN lt_excel
                                              ( %cid      = keys[ 1 ]-%cid_ref
                                                %is_draft = keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft
                                                %data     = VALUE #( end_user   = keys[ 1 ]-end_user
                                                                     Vbeln      = lwa_excel-vbeln
                                                                     New_Fkdat  = lwa_excel-new_fkdat
                                                                     Prev_Fkdat = lwa_excel-prev_fkdat
                                                                     Type       = lwa_excel-type
                                                                     Message    = lwa_excel-message )
                                                %control  = VALUE #( end_user   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Vbeln      = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     New_Fkdat  = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Prev_Fkdat = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Type       = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Message    = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) ) ) ) ).

    "Checking Existing entry in child entity for user if any
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    BY \_XLData
    ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_existing_XLData).

    IF lt_existing_XLData IS NOT INITIAL.
      "Delete already existing entries from child entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLData DELETE FROM VALUE #( FOR lwa_data IN lt_existing_XLData
                                         ( %key      = lwa_data-%key
                                           %is_draft = lwa_data-%is_draft ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_del_mapped)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_del_reported)
      FAILED DATA(ls_del_failed).
    ENDIF.

    "Modify Root View data (Change Status)
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                         ( %is_draft       = key-%is_draft
                           end_user        = key-end_user
                           status          = TEXT-007 "File Processed
                           %control-status = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
    MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
    REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
    FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

    "Add New Entry for XLData (association)
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    CREATE BY \_XLData
    AUTO FILL CID
    WITH lt_data.

    "Read Updated Entry
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    ALL FIELDS WITH
    CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_updated_XLHead).

    "Send Status back to front end
    result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_updated_XLHead
                      ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                        %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  "Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this method
  METHOD downloadData.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lo_columns TYPE REF TO cl_salv_columns_table.
    DATA: lo_column TYPE REF TO cl_salv_column.

    "Fetch Processed Data
    SELECT * FROM ztom_t_excel
    INTO TABLE (lt_final)
    WHERE end_user = -uname.

    IF lt_final IS NOT INITIAL.
      "Get Time Stamp
      GET TIME STAMP FIELD DATA(lv_timestampl).

      "Convert Internal table data to xstring.
      DATA(lv_filename) = |{ TEXT-008 } { lv_timestampl }|. "Billing Date Update Log

      "Convert internal table data to excel and download.
      TRY.
          cl_salv_table=>factory( IMPORTING r_salv_table = DATA(lo_table)
                                  CHANGING  t_table      = lt_final ).

          "Get ALV Column
          lo_columns = lo_table->get_columns( ).

          TRY.
              lo_column = lo_columns->get_column( 'NEW_FKDAT' ).
              lo_column->set_long_text( TEXT-009 ). "New Billing Date
              lo_column->set_output_length( '15' ).
            CATCH cx_salv_not_found INTO DATA(lo_salv_not_found).

              "Implement error handling
              INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                  number   = sy-msgno
                                  severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                  v1       = sy-msgv1
                                  v2       = sy-msgv2
                                  v3       = sy-msgv3
                                  v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                     INTO TABLE reported-%other.
          ENDTRY.

          TRY.
              lo_column = lo_columns->get_column( 'PREV_FKDAT' ).
              lo_column->set_long_text( TEXT-010 ).  "Previous Billing Date
              lo_column->set_output_length( '15' ).
            CATCH cx_salv_not_found INTO lo_salv_not_found.

              "Implement error handling
              INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                  number   = sy-msgno
                                  severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                  v1       = sy-msgv1
                                  v2       = sy-msgv2
                                  v3       = sy-msgv3
                                  v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                     INTO TABLE reported-%other.
          ENDTRY.

          DATA(lv_content) = lo_table->to_xml( xml_type = if_salv_bs_xml=>c_type_xlsx ).

        CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO DATA(lo_salv_msg).

          "Implement error handling
          INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                              number   = sy-msgno
                              severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                              v1       = sy-msgv1
                              v2       = sy-msgv2
                              v3       = sy-msgv3
                              v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                 INTO TABLE reported-%other.
      ENDTRY.

      "Modify Root Entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                           ( end_user            = key-end_user
                             status              = TEXT-011 "Data Downloaded
                             Attachment          = lv_content
                             Filename            = lv_filename
                             MimeType            = TEXT-012   "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
                             %control-status     = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Attachment = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Filename   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-MimeType   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
      FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

      "Read Updated Entry
      READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      ALL FIELDS WITH
      CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
      RESULT DATA(lt_XLHead).

      "Send Status back to front end
      result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_XLHead
                        ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                          %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

*  METHOD earlynumbering_create.
*  DATA(lv_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).
*    LOOP AT entities ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_entities>).

  METHOD get_instance_features.
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    FIELDS ( end_user )
    WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_file).

    result = VALUE #( FOR ls_file IN lt_file
                      ( %key                              = ls_file-%key
                        %is_draft                         = ls_file-%is_draft
                        %features-%action-uploadexceldata = COND #( WHEN ls_file-%is_draft = '00'
                                                                    THEN if_abap_behv=>fc-f-read_only
                                                                    ELSE if_abap_behv=>fc-f-unrestricted ) ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

  • Function Module used in RAP to update Billing Date -
    we have created a remote enabled custom FM ZFM_TOM_BILLING_DATE_UPD as we don't have released SAP APIs available in our system. Then we have rapped it by transaction ACO_PROXY and created a proxy class ZCL_TOM_BILLING_DATE_UPD.
    This proxy class will be called in behavior Implementation class to update billing date.
    Click on Hyperlink to check full blog How to generate a wrapper for function modules (BAPIs) for missing released SAP APIs 

    Function module logic is mentioned below:
FUNCTION zfm_tom_billing_date_upd
  IMPORTING
    VALUE(vbeln) TYPE vbeln_vf
    VALUE(fkdat) TYPE fkdat
  CHANGING
    VALUE(mtype) TYPE bapi_mtype OPTIONAL
    VALUE(message) TYPE bapi_msg OPTIONAL
  EXCEPTIONS
    no_authority.



  DATA: ls_vbrk_i TYPE vbrk,
        ls_vbrk_e TYPE vbrk,
        ls_vbsk   TYPE vbsk.

  DATA: lt_xkomv  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF komv,
        lt_xvbpa  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbpavb,
        lt_xvbrk  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbrkvb,
        lt_xvbrp  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbrpvb,
        lt_xkomfk TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF komfk,
        lt_xvbfs  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbfs,
        lt_xthead TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF theadvb,
        lt_xvbss  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbss.

  CLEAR: ls_vbrk_i,
  ls_vbrk_e,
  ls_vbsk.

  REFRESH: lt_xkomv,
  lt_xvbpa,
  lt_xvbrk,
  lt_xvbrp,
  lt_xkomfk,
  lt_xvbfs,
  lt_xthead,
  lt_xvbss.

  ls_vbrk_i-vbeln = vbeln.

  TRY.
      "Read billing doc
      CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_DOCUMENT_READ'
        EXPORTING
*         ACTIVITY     = '  '
          konv_read    = 'X'
*         NO_NAST      = ' '
          vbrk_i       = ls_vbrk_i
*         I_NO_AUTHORITY_CHECK = ' '
*         OIA_UNZIP_FEES =
*         I_GV_ERDAT_SEL =
*         IV_NO_PRICING_BUFFER = ABAP_FALSE
        IMPORTING
          vbrk_e       = ls_vbrk_e
*         VBUK_E       =
        TABLES
          xkomv        = lt_xkomv
          xvbpa        = lt_xvbpa
          xvbrk        = lt_xvbrk
          xvbrp        = lt_xvbrp
          xkomfk       = lt_xkomfk
          xvbfs        = lt_xvbfs
          xthead       = lt_xthead
          xvbss        = lt_xvbss
*        CHANGING
*         i_data_read_from_archive =
        EXCEPTIONS
          no_authority = 1
          OTHERS       = 2.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
        mtype    = 'E'.
        message = TEXT-001.  "Error in Reading Billing Document

      ELSE.
        "Change Billing Date
        ls_vbrk_e-fkdat = fkdat.   "New Billing date

        "Apply Changes
        CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_HEAD_MAINTAIN'
          EXPORTING
*           FCODE_I = '    '
            vbrk_i = ls_vbrk_e
          TABLES
            xkomfk = lt_xkomfk
            xkomv  = lt_xkomv
            xthead = lt_xthead
            xvbfs  = lt_xvbfs
            xvbpa  = lt_xvbpa
            xvbrk  = lt_xvbrk
            xvbrp  = lt_xvbrp
            xvbss  = lt_xvbss.

        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
          mtype    = 'E'.
          message = TEXT-002.    "Error in Applying Changes

        ELSE.
          ls_vbsk-mandt = sy-mandt.
          ls_vbsk-ernam = ls_vbrk_e-ernam.
          ls_vbsk-erdat = ls_vbrk_e-erdat.
          ls_vbsk-uzeit = ls_vbrk_e-erzet.

          "Save the Changes
          CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_DOCUMENT_ADD'
            EXPORTING
              vbsk_i = ls_vbsk
*             with_posting = 'X'
*             WITHOUT_REFRESH = ' '
*             PREISFINDUNGSART = 'A'
*             I_NO_VBLOG = ' '
*             I_NO_NAST = ' '
*             I_NO_PRICING = ' '
*             I_NO_FI_DOC = ' '
*             I_BLART = ' '
*             IS_FI_ADD_INPUT =
*             I_NO_COLLECTIVE_BILLING =
*             IV_SNAPSHOT_ACTIVATION = ABAP_FALSE
*             IV_SUPPRESS_GTS_IN_SIM_MODE = ABAP_FALSE
*             IV_NO_TAX_CALC_IN_SIM_MODE = ABAP_FALSE
*             IMPORTING
*             VBSK_E =
            TABLES
              xkomfk = lt_xkomfk
              xkomv  = lt_xkomv
              xthead = lt_xthead
              xvbfs  = lt_xvbfs
              xvbpa  = lt_xvbpa
              xvbrk  = lt_xvbrk
              xvbrp  = lt_xvbrp
              xvbss  = lt_xvbss.

          IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
            mtype    = 'E'.
            message = TEXT-003.  "Error in Saving the Changes
          ELSE.
            mtype    = 'S'.
            message = TEXT-004.  "Billing Date Changed Successfully
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.

    CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx).

  ENDTRY.

ENDFUNCTION.â€‹

 

Behavior Projection â€“ ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
projection;
strict ( 2 );
use draft;

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_C_USER //alias XLHead
{
  //  use create;
  use update;
  use delete;

  field ( readonly ) end_user, status, Local_Last_Changed_At;

  use action downloadTemplate;
  use action downloadData; //Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this

  use action Edit;
  use action Activate;
  use action Discard;
  use action Resume;
  use action Prepare;

  use association _XLData { create; with draft; }
}

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL //alias XLData
{
  //  use update; //IF WANT USER TO ENABLE EDIT IN EXCEL DATA UNCOMMENT THIS
  //  use delete; //IF WANT USER TO DELETE PROCESSED EXCEL DATA UNCOMMENT THIS

  use association _XLUser { with draft; }

  //  use action displayDocument; //IF WANT TO ADD A NEW ACTION
}

 

Create Service Definition

Now, let's create Service Definitions, exposing both Behavior Definition and Projection we just created.

Service Definition â€“ ZCDS_TOM_SD_MASS_FKDAT
@EndUserText.label: 'Service Definition for Projection Views'
define service ZCDS_TOM_SD_MASS_FKDAT {
  expose ZCDS_TOM_C_USER as XLHead;
  expose ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL as XLData;
}

 

Create Service Binding

Now, let's create Service Binding (I tested with V2) on top of Service Definition we just created.

If You are using V4 Services, you don't need to create separate action downloadData (comment it out) as we are already having an option to export the data as an excel in V4 Services.

 

See the wonders...ğŸŒŸ

The list report page would look like below for V2 Services, in V4 Services you will see an extra option to export data as an excel- 

Click on Go -

 

Person Responsible will be the Session User, Click anywhere on the line or on arrow - 

 

Click on Download Template button to Load Template, this action can be performed on first screen as well by selection line item and click download template, Template will be loaded successfully as an excel attachment.

 

Click on Hyperlink to download Template.

 

Template can be deleted by clicking on Delete Button, this same delete button will be used to delete processed data entries.

 

Click on Edit button on previous screen and You can now update entries in the template and upload the data.

 

Data will be processed, now click on save.

 

Status will be changed to 'File Processed'.

 

Click on Download Data to load Processed Data as an Excel Attachment.

 

Hope it will be helpful!!

entry.title: BiWhy â€“ CMS DB Analysis
entry.content:
Disclaimer:
 
BiWhy was conceived as comprehensive support tool for SAP BusinessObjects (BOBJ) to troubleshoot issues and facilitate administrative tasks, but as about half of its functionality is not directly tied to BOBJ, it can be used to troubleshoot and monitor other products. That makes it a General-Purpose Support Tool, with the goal of including functionality most demanded by support engineers and software administrators.
 
BiWhy is currently available exclusively through CoE Max Attention Engagements.

 

What it is for:
Analyse CMS DB:
  • Understand your system usage.
  • Identify what is causing growth (count or size-wise).
  • See what is retained over time.
  • Analyze time trends.
 
Compare two snapshots to identify differences and common parts:
  • Between target and source systems to verify promotion.
  • For the same system to see what has changed.
 
When to run it:
  • Occasionally, to get an impression of what is happening in the system and for housekeeping purposes.
  • NB: Before migration or major promotions, it is a good idea to clean up the CMS DB to speed up promotion and reduce the number of failures.
 
Background
  • This functionality has already been used with more than 38 customers, in some cases repeatedly and across multiple systems.
  • The largest CMS DB processed contained 34 million objects.
  • CMS DB fetch is optimized with indexed fields, filters, self-tuning batch size, and incremental fetch options.
 
Analysis & Visualization with BiWhy Embedded Analytic Controls
  • Flexible table:
    • Show/hide columns
    • Group/aggregate
    • Regex filters for any column
    • Global and local statistics
    • Export to Excel
  • Set of charts
  • CMS DB tree:
    • Build by folders or parents
    • Choose how to view a node (show/hide any available field)
    • Sort by selected field
    • Search

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series â€“ Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content:
@tsvetomir_mlade :

The FOS layer (HDLF â€“ HANA Data Lake Files / Object Store) enables customers to adopt a data lake house architecture. Its main benefit is cost-effective, high-volume storage, making it well-suited for scenarios such as advanced analytics, AI/ML, and long-term historical reporting. For example, AI/ML models often require 5â€“10 years of data for better outcomes, which can be stored more economically in FOS. Please read top 5 Q&A.

However, there is a trade-off between performance and cost:

  • HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) provides the best performance (disk + in-memory) but comes with higher infrastructure cost.

  • FOS (HDLF / BDC-FOS) offers low-cost persistence but requires data to be read from files into memory, which impacts performance.

Thatâ€™s why in practice, the recommendation is usually a hybrid approach, combining different storage and access methods depending on the use case:

  1. HDLF (BDC-FOS / Data Lakehouse) â€“ Best for AI/ML, historical, or archived reporting where large volumes of data are needed but not always in real-time.

  2. HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) â€“ Best for frequently accessed data where high performance is critical.
  3. Data Federation / Remote Access (CDS Views from S/4) â€“ Best for real-time operational analytics without data replication.

Example scenario â€“ Sales Data (2021â€“2025):

  • HDLF (BDC-FOS) â€“ Store older years (e.g., 2021â€“2023) for cost-effective long-term analysis.

  • HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) â€“ Keep the most recent year (e.g., 2024) for high-performance analytics.
  • Remote Access (CDS Views) â€“ Use live, current-year data (e.g., 2025) for real-time reporting.

A reporting model can then union across these layers, with performance depending on the storage source.

In short, data products are not just about persistenceâ€”they enable customers to balance cost, performance, and business requirements by combining multiple technologies (FOS + HANA Cloud DB + Federation).

Hope this clarifies â€“ Jeet

entry.title: Extend nested standard CDS-Views

However, there are hardly any standard CDS views that have only one level, but rather multiple ones. The question that arises for me is whether it is always necessary to extend all levels in order to access a field on the "top" level. Or what is the best practice in this case (for example: extend all views? Lukas

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud â€“ Blog #2 in the Series
entry.content:
In my previous blog, I discussed how SAP HANA Cloud delivers critical business benefits to organizations that migrate their database to the cloud. Advanced features such as multi-model engines allow enterprises to increase productivity and reduce complexity. In a recent study,[1]  IDC calculated that large enterprises can realize an annual average value of US$13.7 million by using SAP HANA Cloud.

Understanding how the specific capabilities of the database benefit your organization is key to helping you justify a cloud modernization initiative. Letâ€™s look at two more capabilities that can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud: infrastructure independence and a next-generation application foundation.

Infrastructure independence

Your database requirements constantly evolve. To keep up with changing business conditions, customer requirements, and user demand, you need an infrastructure that matches your needs. A solution that offers vendor independence is key.

SAP HANA Cloud offers multi-cloud flexibility so you can run on your hyperscaler of choice. The cloud-native architecture runs on Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Alibaba Cloud, and soon, SAP data centers. You can choose a hyperscaler without fear of vendor lock-in.

 

Because it uses cloud-native technologies, the architecture offers consistent, high performance no matter which provider you choose. Automated failover and recovery features enhance resilience. Database administrators can provision new instances in just minutes. And elastic scaling capabilities respond to changing workload demands in real time.

SAP HANA Cloud also reduces the complexity of database operations. It simplifies integration across hybrid or multi-cloud environments and provides direct access to data in SAP applications. Because SAP HANA Cloud is a fully managed database-as-a-service (DBaaS) from SAP, your IT personnel are free to focus on value-added tasks. Whatâ€™s more, SAP HANA Cloud covers your database, infrastructure, and management requirements, eliminating the need for a separate infrastructure contract with your hyperscaler.

The IDC study assessed the financial impact of infrastructure independence and the associated flexibility. After deploying SAP HANA Cloud, study participants reported a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams and said that database deployments were executed 38% faster. Considering the costs of IT staff management, unplanned downtime, and database infrastructure, IDC calculated a 35% lower annual total cost of ownership for SAP HANA Cloud over a three-year period.

According to one study participant with a large database environment,

â€œSAP HANA Cloud has enabled us to redirect IT staff to focus more on the production environment, new development, integration, and leveraging AI. Overall, this allows them to help drive revenue and increase productivity.â€

Next-generation application foundation

To gain business value from modern, intelligent applications, you need a sophisticated database that can support multiple data types from various sources, process data in real time, and deliver insightful analytics.

SAP HANA Cloud is part of SAP Business Technology Platform, an open cloud platform with data management, analytics, AI, IoT, blockchain technologies and application development services. Together, SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP form a full-stack solution that includes powerful integration features and an intuitive interface, all under one commercial model.  In addition, SAP HANA Cloud is the trusted database that powers SAPâ€™s mission-critical solutions, such as SAP Business Cloud, with multi-model engines and enterprise-grade performance and reliability.

SAP HANA Cloud also empowers developers to create intelligent applications using todayâ€™s most advanced technologies. With this database, teams can build applications that use generative AI, machine learning, and specialized engines to handle vectors, knowledge graphs, property graphs, and spatial processing. It also manages semi-structured JSON data with ACID compliance. The resulting applications are context-aware and offer secure connections to critical business data and curated data products from SAP.

This integrated approach allows applications to ingest and process data in multiple formats and from various sources, including SAP and third-party solutions. Users get live access to critical business information without data replication. Native connectivity to various data sources unifies disparate data streams, offering a single holistic view of your enterprise data. Applications can respond to events in real time, support automated processes, and enable ad-hoc decision-making using current and historical data.

 Having a next-generation application foundation adds IT, performance, and business enablement benefits, according to the IDC study. After adopting SAP HANA Cloud, participating organizations realized a 33% efficiency boost for their infrastructure teams. Query speed and response time increased by 31% and 29%, respectively. Enterprises processed 151% more data sources and 77% greater data volume (in terabytes) than in previous environments. Business operations improved, thanks to enhanced analytics that led to better business decisions, an accelerated application development process, and more agile deployment of database resources. Participants also realized end-user productivity gains of 18%, leading to annual gross revenue gains of nearly $40 million per organization.

A study participant who works in the healthcare industry summarized the value of SAP HANA Cloud.

â€œSAP HANA Cloud provides my organization the ability to apply parallel processes and maintain scalable databases,â€ he said. â€œAs a result, we have been able to build a lot of applications with machine learning and AI capabilities. With SAP HANA Cloud, it is easier to integrate these applications.â€

Explore other SAP HANA Cloud features to build your business case

Read the next blog to learn how multi-dimensional elastic scalability and intelligent data tiering features in SAP HANA Cloud can help you build your business case while preparing for the future of modern, intelligent applications and processes.

 

Additional resources:

Whatâ€™s the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 

Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.

Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.

Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1]  â€œThe Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,â€ IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.title: How to Post Exchange Rate Differences to P&L Instead of Inventory in Purchase Orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

Iâ€™m working on a case in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud involving foreign currency valuation in purchase orders.

Here's the scenario:

  • A purchase order is created in USD.
  • At the time of goods receipt (MIGO), the exchange rate is 1.1 EUR/USD.
  • Later, when the invoice is posted, the exchange rate has changed to 1.2 EUR/USD.

    SAP automatically posts the exchange rate difference, but this difference is currently being added to the inventory value â€” increasing the purchase cost of the material.

    What I need is for this exchange rate difference to be posted to a profit and loss account (e.g., exchange rate gain/loss), not to inventory.

    Is there a way to configure this behavior in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? Perhaps through account determination, valuation classes, or SSCUI settings?

    Any guidance or documentation would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance!

entry.title: AI-driven, Joule-enabled Warehouse Resource & Operations Management for SAP EWM on S/4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
It is a topic in every warehouse: Supervisors and Warehouse Operations Managers would like to see their planned workload for the day and see in real-time whether shipping times will be met. If shipping times are in jeopardy, the warehouse system is then expected to evaluate if an optimized resource allocation could pro-actively solve any potential delays. When a more optimal usage of the available resources is found, resources should automatically be directed to the critical areas. Being able to take action proactively is of the essence, because we do not want to only take action when we are already in delay.

The following is an example of an AI-driven, Joule enabled Application that can accomplish the above outlined requirements and activities supported by AI. The Application leverages the embedded AI in the EWM Private Cloud Edition S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 release and the Joule Studio available in SAP Build.

 

 

The Architecture of the Application looks as follows:

 

AI-based Warehouse Workload Visibility

In the current version of the Application, the expected workloads of picking and packing operations are calculated leveraging the embedded AI capabilities in SAP EWM, which are then displayed in the UI5 Application (see in the example below):

It is also clearly visible in which Activity Area the workload is currently exceeding the planned Resource capacity.

The Application then further allows a manual simulation of adding or removing Resources to evaluate the impact in a given activity area. 

The fully "automatic rebalancing" function evaluates whether it is possible to optimize the resource allocation to the different areas, considering the allowed resource types in an Activity Area.

If an optimized resource allocation is possible, the warehouse operations manager, can accept these changes and the resources will be reassigned in the EWM system so that they will receive workload to execute from the new area.

Joule-enabled with custom EWM Joule Skills

Further more the current version of the Application provides Joule support for Warehouse Operations Management with the following Joule Skills:

- Joule Skill 1: Current Workload Analysis: Provide a comprehensive analysis of the current workload associated with picking and packing operations, considering the current resource allocation across different warehouse areas, as well as dependent scheduling of packing activities.
- Joule Skill 2: Provide Optimized Resource Allocation: Simulate an optimal workforce allocation strategy to mitigate bottlenecks and criticalities within the warehouse operations, to avoid shipping delays.
- Joule Skill 3: Accept Optimized Resource Allocation: Accept the optimization results and reassign the resources in EWM to the new areas.   

Coming soon an AI Agent will be introduce that autonomously orchestrates workforce allocation (monitored by the supervisor).

For more Information on this Application & AI functionality please contact SAP Services (EWMServices@sap.com).

entry.title: Re: TM Public Cloud - Transportation cockpit enhancement...

Hi @zsoci

The handling of transportation forms like Waybill, CMR and Subcontracting Form is based on Output Management with Adobe Forms. You cannot change SAP-delivered standard forms directly.

However, you can create a copy of the standard form template in the maintain Form Templates app, enhance it with additional fields or make layout changes using Adobe LiveCycle Designer. Then assign your custom form to the relevant output type through the Output Parameter Determination.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Holiday Readiness â€“ Secure Your Backoffice Before Peak Season
entry.content:
As part of the SAP Holiday Season Readiness Program, weâ€™re helping you prepare for record-breaking traffic and sales. One critical step: protect your Backoffice and HAC from public exposure.

 

Why It Matters

Your Backoffice powers essential operations behind the scenes, non-customer-facing operations that supports crucial administrative and operational functions to ensure an e-commerce business runs smoothly, allowing businesses to scale.

Your Backoffice/HAC has administrative privileges in your e-commerce data and should not strictly be accessible publicly. It is vital to make sure that the environments are secure, to avoid a strong possibility of an attack leveraging them. If exposed to the internet, it becomes a high-value target for attackersâ€”especially during the holiday rush.

Risks of Exposure

  • ğŸ”“ Unauthorized Access - Attackers can discover and access internal systems without authentication barriers.
  • ğŸ¤– Brute Force & Credential Stuffing Attacks - Login portals are targeted with automated password-guessing tools.
  • ğŸ•µï¸â€ Sensitive Data Exposure - Internal dashboards or APIs may leak customer PII, business data, or system logs.
  • ğŸ’£ Malware & Ransomware Infection - Open endpoints can be used to deploy malicious payloads to internal systems.
  • â¬†ï¸ Privilege Escalation - If attackers get in, they may gain administrative privileges and full control of the backend.
  • ğŸ“‰ Reputational and Operational Impact - Downtime, data loss, and customer trust erosion can result from a breach.

How to Protect

  • Remove 0.0.0.0/0 (allow all) from your allow list.
  • Implement IP Filters and VPN for secure access.

ğŸ“š SAP Guidelines:

  • IP Filter Configuration
  • VPN Setup

Act now to secure your Backoffice before the holiday surge.

entry.title: Prevent Sensitive Data Exposure in URLs
entry.content:
High traffic means more transactionsâ€”and more risk. A common misconfiguration during integrations is sending PII data in the URL of a POST request instead of in the request body. This can lead to serious data leaks.

 

Why Itâ€™s Dangerous

URLs can be logged, cached, and exposed in browser history or analytics tools, making sensitive data vulnerable.

ğŸ”Learn more: OWASP Guidelines

How to Fix It

  • Configure the POST request in a secured way. Always send PII in the body of the POST request, never in the URL.

ğŸ“š SAP Guidelines:

  • SAP CX Commerce Cloud Security Guide

Secure your integrations now to protect customer trust during peak season.

entry.title: Eliminate Default Password Risks
entry.content:
Default passwords are an open invitation for attackers and should not be in use in your environments. All default passwords involved should be changed immediately to make sure that your environments are safe and secure. With holiday traffic surging, the stakes are higher than ever.

 

Whatâ€™s at Risk

  • ğŸ”“ Unauthorized Access - Attackers can log in easily using well-known default credentials.
  • ğŸ’¥ Website Defacement - Hackers may change content, inject malicious scripts, or vandalize the site.
  • ğŸ›  Privilege Escalation - Default credentials may allow full admin access.
  • ğŸ“‰ Reputational Damage - Compromises can erode user trust and damage your brand.

What You Should Do

  • Change all default passwords immediately.
  • Regularly review and update credentials.

ğŸ“š SAP Guidelines:

  • Change Backoffice Password
  • Update Built-in User Passwords

Need help? Open a support ticket today.

  2. Create a $batch request containing one changeset.

  3. As first operation of the changeset, include a PATCH A_SalesOrder with the LastChangeDateTime property. Provide the LastChangeDateTime content also in the request header in the If-Match field.

entry.title: Re: e-Doc Submission Error from SD Module Due to Missing...
entry.content:
1. Ensure Posting Before Sending
  • Confirm that the export document is posted in SAP before triggering the â€œSendâ€ action in the cockpit.
  • Posting ensures that the discharge date and other required fields are populated.
  1. Check for Missing Data
  • Use the error display feature in the cockpit:
    • Double-click the Logs/File column in the cockpit to open the details pane.
    • Review the application log, interface log, and last file for specific error messages.
  1. Correct and Resubmit
  • If the discharge date or other mandatory fields are missing:
    • Cancel the current eDocument.
    • Manually cancel the source document if needed.
    • Correct the data (e.g., populate the discharge date).
    • Resubmit the eDocument
  1. Customizing Settings
  • Ensure that the Document Compliance Framework is properly configured:
    • Maintain parameters in EDOGENCUST (e.g., NEW_SCREEN = X) to enable detailed error views.
    • Refer to SAP Note 3005076 for additional configuration guidance

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series â€“ Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@MelCalucin : Please find the below answers:

  • In a typical medallion architecture, the layers serve different purposes:

    Bronze Data Layer: raw source data, ingested as-is. Silver Data Layer: cleansed and transformed data. Gold Data Layer: business-ready data enriched with semantics, associations, unions and joins.
    Depending on data quality from the source and business requirements, you may design 3 layers, 2 layers, or even just 1.

  • The exact approach depends on the use case. For example, a Sales Order CDS view already combines data from both Sales Header and Item views.

  • As a best practice, customers should leverage SAP-released CDS views first, extend them where needed, and only create custom CDS views when business requirements demand it. This is fully permissible under the clean core paradigm, as business requirements ultimately take priority.

Hope this helps, Jeet

entry.title: SAP MES - Add formula to work instruction?
entry.content:
Currently I have the following example system in place.

  • Part number 123 has an instruction to mill it to a thickness of 2in +/-.1in
  • Part Number 456 has an instruction to mill it to a thickness of 3in +/-.15in
  • Currently there are two work instructions one called Milling_123 where the instruction is fully written out as "Mill to 2in +/-.1in" and another instruction called Milling_456 where the instruction is written as "Mill to 3in +/-.15in"

Is it possible to add either a formula to a work instruction or some sort of parameterization so that we could have one instruction simply called "Milling" where it is written as something like

  • "Mill to _nominaldimension_ +/- _tolerance_" and those _xxx_ values are found by looking up values in the SQL database for each part number?
  • That way we only need one work instruction and we can make small clerical changes once while still keeping all of the important dimensions simply referenced from the database.
  • This sort of parameterization works for the formula function in data collection but I can't seem to find if it's possible to do it in work instructions.

entry.title: Re: How to Post Exchange Rate Differences to P&L Instead...
entry.content: @AlvaroFernandezMorales solution is to change the material's price control from Moving Average Price (V) to Standard Price (S) and then verify the account assignment for transaction keys PRD and KDM in the "Configure Automatic Account Determination" app (F1273).

entry.title: Re: How to Post Exchange Rate Differences to P&L Instead...
entry.content:
Hello @AlvaroFernandezMorales 

Thank you for your question.

The system behaviour you described is known. The reason behind that is, for inventory managed materials, all exchange rate differences between goods receipt and invoice receipt are posted into inventory valuation. This follows the moving average price principle in Public Cloud, where inventory reflects the true acquisition cost including currency fluctuation. Because of this, you cannot configure the system to post such differences directly to the P&L for stock materials.

The reason why you cannot change it via SSCUIs/Account determination is because in public cloud,

  • Account determination for Goods receipt/Invoice receipt and price differences is predefined and limited to configuration via SSCUIs.
  • However, foreign currency differences in purchase orders are automatically adjusted into the inventory if the material is stock-managed and not routed through the price difference or exchange rate different accounts.
  • The only time currency differences hit P&L account is when the procurement is for non-stock materials or service consumption postings but not for inventory.

There are a few options to serve as a workaround.

  • First one looks at non-stock procurement. If your requirement is to isolate FX differences in P&L then configure the material as consumption based. This ensures the entire purchase will hit P&L accounts which includes exchange rate variances.
  • Second, keep stock-manage procurement but report separately on exchange rate affects. You can do this through embedded analytics or custom CDS views.

Consider submitting a customer Influence Request for public cloud to allow routing FX differences to P&L.

Consult the below references for more details.

Inventory Balance Sheet Valuations (App ID: F3343)

Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris
